results.title: ‘Treasure Planet’ at 20: Disney’s Failed Space Odyssey Deserved to Soar
results.abstract: This maligned flight of fancy contains a trove of underrated accomplishments worthy of reappraisal.

results.title: ‘A Man Called Otto’ Review: Tom Hanks Learns Life Lessons
results.abstract: Going against nice-guy type (at first), the star plays a misanthrope who’s pulled into caring for a neighboring family in need.

results.title: ‘Turn Every Page’ Review: It’s Not Done Yet
results.abstract: This affectionate documentary about the writer Robert Caro and the editor Robert Gottlieb sets out to shed light on their 50 years of collaboration.

results.title: ‘Wildcat’ Review: Rescue and Rewild
results.abstract: This documentary follows a couple’s efforts to reintroduce an ocelot, headed to a zoo or worse, into its home in the Peruvian Amazon.

results.title: ‘Broadway Rising’ Review: Surviving the Pandemic

results.title: Advice From a Political Daughter: ‘Every Woman Needs a Paul Pelosi’
results.abstract: Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s husband, a multimillionaire venture capitalist recovering from a brutal attack, has long taken care of the couple’s “business of living,” including shopping for the speaker’s clothes.

results.title: A ‘Titanic’ Parody Show That Draws Fans Near, Far, Wherever They Are
results.abstract: Some of the devotees of ‘Titanique,’ which recently moved to the larger Daryl Roth Theater after months of sold-out shows, have seen it more than a dozen times.

multimedia.caption: Since opening at Asylum NYC’s 150-seat basement theater in Chelsea in June, the show has been consistently sold out, thanks to strong word of mouth and a passionate social media following.

results.title: Mickey’s Copyright Adventure: Early Disney Creation Will Soon Be Public Property

results.title: How Well Do You Know Modern Variations of “A Christmas Carol”?
results.abstract: Adaptations of this classic holiday story have been appearing on stage and screen for more than a century, but how much do you know about more recent versions?

results.title: Mike Hodges, Director Acclaimed for ‘Get Carter,’ Dies at 90
results.abstract: He was best known for complex crime dramas like “Croupier.” But he also made the big-budget 1980 science-fiction yarn “Flash Gordon.”

multimedia.caption: Mr. Hodges, center, directing “Flash Gordon” (1980). The movie “is cheerfully willing to look as phony as it is,” Roger Ebert wrote. “I don’t mean that as a criticism.”
